alert.note: Alert for Coastal Chatham; Inland Bryan; Inland Chatham; Inland Liberty (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 4:59PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BRYAN, LIBERTY, EFFINGHAM AND CHATHAM COUNTIES... At 458 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pembroke to 8 miles west of Richmond Hill, and moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph and excessive cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. All outdoor activities should cease. Move indoors immediately. Some locations in the path of these storms include... Pooler, Richmond Hill, Pembroke, Windsor Forest, I-16/I-95 Interchange, Godley Station, Coffee Bluff, and Hunter Army Airfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Chatham; Inland Bryan; Inland Chatham; Inland Liberty
